Based on information available up to May 1, 2025, Ashok Leyland experienced a mixed performance in April 2025, followed by a rebound in May 2025:

Ashok Leyland's total sales in April 2025 declined by 6% year-on-year to 13,421 units. Domestic sales fell 7% to 12,509 units. The M&HCV segment's domestic sales dropped 14% to 7,406 units, while LCV domestic sales increased 6% to 5,103 units. The company also announced a second interim dividend for FY25, payable in June 2025.

May 2025 (Partial Rebound):

In May 2025, total vehicle sales rose 5% year-on-year to 15,484 units. This was driven by a 10% increase in domestic M&HCV sales to 9,386 units, while domestic LCV sales saw a 3% decline to 5,148 units.

Industry Context (April 2025):

The Indian commercial vehicle industry experienced a slight overall decline in April 2025. Despite a sales drop, Ashok Leyland maintained a 17% market share in the CV segment that month.

Note: The information above represents a snapshot of Ashok Leyland's performance and relevant industry context up to May 1, 2025, based on available news and reports.
